issue.title: ci(): try pull_request_target event to give access to fork prs
issue.body:
<!--
        Hi there!
        Thanks for taking the time and putting the effort into making fabric better! 💖
        Take a look at /CONTRIBUTING.md for crucial instructions regarding local setup, testing etc.
        https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

        Adding tests that verify your fix and safeguard it from unwanted loss and changes is a MUST.

        Pull Requests are not always simple. Don't hesitate to ask for help (beware of [gotchas](http://fabricjs.com/fabric-gotchas) 😓).
        We appreciate your effort and would like the process to be productive and enjoyable.
        A strong community means a strong and better product for everyone.
-->

## Motivation

This is trying to solve the issue in #8336 

The pull_request_target should allow the PR to run on the workflow of the base branch of the pr, so not allowing forks to commit changes to workflows, making the workflows they run trusted and so writable.

I have no idea how it works in combination with the pull_request event, i guess we can find out

<!-- Why you are proposing -->
<!-- You can use the @closes notation to mark issues that will be resolved by this PR -->

comment.body: for build stats we can revert, we compare the master branch with the pull request head instead of vice versa.

issue.title: [QA]:  Upper Canvas and Lower Canvas not working together well after zooming
issue.body:
### CheckList

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
- [X] I have read and followed the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [X] I have read and followed the [Issue Tracker Guide](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#%EF%B8%8F-issue-tracker)
- [X] I have searched and referenced existing issues and discussions
- [X] I am filing a **BUG** report.
- [X] I have managed to reproduce the bug **after** upgrading to the **latest** version
- [X] I have created an accurate and minimal reproduction

### Version

5.3.0

### In What environments are you experiencing the problem?

Chrome

### Node Version (if applicable)

None

### Link To Reproduction

https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/1/

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open The Fiddle ( https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/1/ )
2. Draw (See if it is working)
3. Zoom in or out
4. Draw (Now the image is scaling  moving after the draw)

### Expected Behavior

I am implementing a custom Brush for drawing without noisy colors and using canvas.contextTop (upperCanvas). When I draw without zooming it works and draws the image to the exact place and noise free. After zooming and using Lower Canvas pointer events, drawing at Upper Canvas rendering will be far from the pointer but puts the drawn image to Lower Canvas perfectly ( https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/3/   zoom canvas to see the issue). When I use Upper Canvas pointers, It draws well in Upper Canvas but It will not put the drawn image in the same place  ( https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/1/   zoom canvas to see the issue). When I scale the image and put it into Lower Canvas,  it will create redundant colors with alpha.

### Actual Behavior

 Upper Canvas and  Lower Canvas zooming should work together synced and After Drawing drawn content should not contain other noise colors (same color but with alpha).

### Error Message & Stack Trace

_No response_

comment.body:
> > it is bad design that brushes are affected by vpt
> 
> Brushes have to work with vpt in mind, they take vpt at minimum, they work with the standard canvas/design coordinates and do transform the context before drawing because the upper canvas is usually not transformed.
> 
> To not be affected by vpt they should capture the points in html coordinates and then transform them before finalizing the operation.
> 
> In this case @shahzodjonweb had a peculiar design, to take whatever was on the upper canvas and add it as an image, if the brushes were or weren't affected by VPT I think he would have the same exact issue because he is mixing two things that live in different spaces by design

Because my requirement is drawn part should correspond with the image pixels in the background canvas while and after drawing. It should not add unwanted alpha noises. Adding Paths didn't work that way, it is adding alpha colors when converted to image. If you have a better solution, I appreciate it).

comment.body: no this is not what we want.

issue.title: [QA]:  Upper Canvas and Lower Canvas not working together well after zooming
issue.body:
### CheckList

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
- [X] I have read and followed the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [X] I have read and followed the [Issue Tracker Guide](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#%EF%B8%8F-issue-tracker)
- [X] I have searched and referenced existing issues and discussions
- [X] I am filing a **BUG** report.
- [X] I have managed to reproduce the bug **after** upgrading to the **latest** version
- [X] I have created an accurate and minimal reproduction

### Version

5.3.0

### In What environments are you experiencing the problem?

Chrome

### Node Version (if applicable)

None

### Link To Reproduction

https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/1/

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Open The Fiddle ( https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/1/ )
2. Draw (See if it is working)
3. Zoom in or out
4. Draw (Now the image is scaling  moving after the draw)

### Expected Behavior

I am implementing a custom Brush for drawing without noisy colors and using canvas.contextTop (upperCanvas). When I draw without zooming it works and draws the image to the exact place and noise free. After zooming and using Lower Canvas pointer events, drawing at Upper Canvas rendering will be far from the pointer but puts the drawn image to Lower Canvas perfectly ( https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/3/   zoom canvas to see the issue). When I use Upper Canvas pointers, It draws well in Upper Canvas but It will not put the drawn image in the same place  ( https://jsfiddle.net/qsz2n0f4/1/   zoom canvas to see the issue). When I scale the image and put it into Lower Canvas,  it will create redundant colors with alpha.

### Actual Behavior

 Upper Canvas and  Lower Canvas zooming should work together synced and After Drawing drawn content should not contain other noise colors (same color but with alpha).

### Error Message & Stack Trace

_No response_

comment.body:
> seems you did not account for the viewwportTransform/dpr https://jsfiddle.net/fg3rnc8a/5/
> 
> ```js
>     const dpr = this.canvas.getRetinaScaling()
>     fabric.util.addTransformToObject(img, fabric.util.invertTransform(fabric.util.multiplyTransformMatrices([dpr, 0, 0, dpr, 0, 0], this.canvas.viewportTransform)))
> ```

Hi, thanks for your response. The drawing is working as expected. But there is still one issue, it is adding color noise while drawing in Zoom. I need to draw with colors without alpha , because later I need to extract the drawn image from the canvas which should be free from unwanted colors. Is there anything you can advise on this?

issue.title: ci(): try pull_request_target event to give access to fork prs
issue.body:
<!--
        Hi there!
        Thanks for taking the time and putting the effort into making fabric better! 💖
        Take a look at /CONTRIBUTING.md for crucial instructions regarding local setup, testing etc.
        https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

        Adding tests that verify your fix and safeguard it from unwanted loss and changes is a MUST.

        Pull Requests are not always simple. Don't hesitate to ask for help (beware of [gotchas](http://fabricjs.com/fabric-gotchas) 😓).
        We appreciate your effort and would like the process to be productive and enjoyable.
        A strong community means a strong and better product for everyone.
-->

## Motivation

This is trying to solve the issue in #8336 

The pull_request_target should allow the PR to run on the workflow of the base branch of the pr, so not allowing forks to commit changes to workflows, making the workflows they run trusted and so writable.

I have no idea how it works in combination with the pull_request event, i guess we can find out

<!-- Why you are proposing -->
<!-- You can use the @closes notation to mark issues that will be resolved by this PR -->

        Hi there!

        Pull Requests are not always simple. Don't hesitate to ask for help (beware of [gotchas](http://fabricjs.com/fabric-gotchas) 😓).
        We appreciate your effort and would like the process to be productive and enjoyable.
        A strong community means a strong and better product for everyone.
-->

## Motivation

This is trying to solve the issue in #8336 

The pull_request_target should allow the PR to run on the workflow of the base branch of the pr, so not allowing forks to commit changes to workflows, making the workflows they run trusted and so writable.

I have no idea how it works in combination with the pull_request event, i guess we can find out

<!-- Why you are proposing -->
<!-- You can use the @closes notation to mark issues that will be resolved by this PR -->

issue.title: [Bug]: Invisible text when a gradient or pattern is applied
issue.body:
### CheckList

- [X] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct
- [X] I have read and followed the [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md)
- [X] I have read and followed the [Issue Tracker Guide](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#%EF%B8%8F-issue-tracker)
- [X] I have searched and referenced existing issues and discussions
- [X] I am filing a **BUG** report.
- [X] I have managed to reproduce the bug **after** upgrading to the **latest** version
- [X] I have created an accurate and minimal reproduction

### Version

5.3.0

### In What environments are you experiencing the problem?

Chrome

### Node Version (if applicable)

None

### Link To Reproduction

https://jsfiddle.net/yrpuqvec/

### Steps To Reproduce

1. Create Text object
2. Apply gradient
3. The text is invisible


### Expected Behavior

Text fill with gradient and visible

### Actual Behavior

![gradient_text_chrome_problem](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/assets/131244197/100904da-91de-4b60-a4ed-cc100e9f708d)
![gradient_text_firefox_ok](https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/assets/131244197/1d1124f5-78f7-4a0e-9aff-83245875a0cb)


### Error Message & Stack Trace

_No response_

comment.body:
Hi,
Any solution for fill Text with patterns in chrome, yet?

comment.body:
I saw the same about other things.
Sometimes you disagree and point out we want a lean codebase.
There is no usage and it is extremely simple to call `findTarget` from a mouseup handler.
Anyways I don't mind, feel free to close or merge

commits.message: refactor(Canvas): BREAKING remove button from mouse events, delegate to event.button property (#9449)

pull_request.title: refactor(Canvas): BREAKING: remove button from mouse events, delegate to event.button property
pull_request.body:
<!--
        Hi there!
        Thanks for taking the time and putting the effort into making fabric better! 💖
        Take a look at /CONTRIBUTING.md for crucial instructions regarding local setup, testing etc.
        https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

        Adding tests that verify your fix and safeguard it from unwanted loss and changes is a MUST.

        Pull Requests are not always simple. Don't hesitate to ask for help (beware of [gotchas](http://fabricjs.com/fabric-gotchas) 😓).
        We appreciate your effort and would like the process to be productive and enjoyable.
        A strong community means a strong and better product for everyone.
-->

## Motivation

<!-- Why you are proposing -->
<!-- You can use the @closes notation to mark issues that will be resolved by this PR -->

#9434 made me look at the unused `button` property

## Description

first merge #9434 

Remove the `button` property of `TPointerEventInfo` because of the following:

- it is unused 
- the dev can/should access it from `e` directly
- the values do not match `e.button` and cause confusion

<!-- What you are proposing -->

## Changes

<!-- before the fix vs. after -->

- removed `button` from event
- fixed `notALeftClick` in text click

## Gist

<!-- Technical stuff if necessary -->

## In Action

<!-- Show case your accomplishment -->
<!-- Upload screenshots, screencasts and live examples showing your fix in contrast to the current state -->

pull_request.title: refactor(Canvas): BREAKING: remove button from mouse events, delegate to event.button property
pull_request.body:
<!--
        Hi there!
        Thanks for taking the time and putting the effort into making fabric better! 💖
        Take a look at /CONTRIBUTING.md for crucial instructions regarding local setup, testing etc.
        https://github.com/fabricjs/fabric.js/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md

        Adding tests that verify your fix and safeguard it from unwanted loss and changes is a MUST.

        Pull Requests are not always simple. Don't hesitate to ask for help (beware of [gotchas](http://fabricjs.com/fabric-gotchas) 😓).
        We appreciate your effort and would like the process to be productive and enjoyable.
        A strong community means a strong and better product for everyone.
-->

## Motivation

<!-- Why you are proposing -->
<!-- You can use the @closes notation to mark issues that will be resolved by this PR -->

#9434 made me look at the unused `button` property

## Description

first merge #9434 

Remove the `button` property of `TPointerEventInfo` because of the following:

- it is unused 
- the dev can/should access it from `e` directly
- the values do not match `e.button` and cause confusion

<!-- What you are proposing -->

## Changes

<!-- before the fix vs. after -->

- removed `button` from event
- fixed `notALeftClick` in text click

## Gist

<!-- Technical stuff if necessary -->

## In Action

<!-- Show case your accomplishment -->
<!-- Upload screenshots, screencasts and live examples showing your fix in contrast to the current state -->
